message: @deancollins as far as I know, Sprint offers truly unlimited plans.

i'm planning on leaving verizon because they are cancelling 1 year plans and i dont want to get locked into a 2 year contract (i change my phones out pretty much every 12-16 months).

So hunting aroudn the alternatives, i hardly use voice so looking at 450m plans when i read this in the fine print on the Tmobile contracts.


• Unlimited data - including 2 GB of high speed data (after 2 GB, data speeds will be reduced for the remainder of that billing cycle)

rofl. since when was unlimited = 2gb?

T Mobile you fail i guess i'm left with at&t and sprint.
I'd rather them throttle me after 2GB (which I've never used in one month) than charge me more.
@brax4444 Or better yet, give us an option...

@undefined Well AT&T will charge you overage, as well as verizon. I believe they are 0.05 cents a MB .. I personally would rather be throttled and not charged overage. However the throttle is realllllyyyyy slow.
I've heard that the cell phone companies get away with this because they say that "unlimited" means you can access it 24/7.
@undefined they get away with it because there is not enough competition.
with data and text, i feel the cell phone world is a monopoly and need to be check out, i mean apple is getting check out but my text plan is out of control it pisses me off so much
@undefined And despite this, some people think it's okay to have two of the 4 major cell carriers combine...

Back in the 80's AT&T was split up under the Sherman AntiTrust Act .. not sure who here is old enough to remember that but if the AT&T/T-Mobile merger is allowed to happen then they'll have their monopoly again... the merger can't happen... period.

Not sure how much good it will end up doing, but the FCC is taking public comments about the proposed merger:
http://www.engadget.com/2011/04/30/fcc-opens-floor-for-public-comment-on-atandt-t-mobile-deal/
